instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message: This 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board looks completely undamaged. It appears fully functional except that the Touch Bar neither illuminates nor registers touch. I tried connecting a known-good spare Touch Bar and nothing. Any pointers for how to troubleshoot this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message:
So machine boots correctly into macOS, no critical update error reported?

Did you check any voltage and signal on touchbar connectors?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message: Machine fully boots, no errors. So far I have checked the 1.8, 3.3, and 5V rails for the Touch Bar connectors and they are all there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message:
Check J5100 signals; pins 1, 2, 13, 15, 18.
Compare with good board, if possible.

You can also check J5110; pins 10 & 12.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message:
I haven't compared to a good board, but here are the signals (with connected Touch Bar):

J5100
pin 1: 1.8 (0V with Touch Bar disconnected)
pin 2: 0V
pin 13: 1.8
pin 15: 0.5 (0V with Touch Bar disconnected)
pin 18: 1.8 (0V with Touch Bar disconnected)

J5110
pin 10: 0V
pin 12: 1.8

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message:
Not sure about <SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_CLK32K_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_INT</SIGNAL>.
You should compare with other board; even not the same model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message: The only other Touch Bar board I have right now is activation locked and I can't get the bar to turn on. Will check back in when I have good board comparison measurements.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message: What said the client about how failure appeared?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro without Touch Bar functionality
threads.message: Actually, I just found the culprit: there was a mechanical issue with J5100, preventing contact on some pins. Touch Bar is fully functional now. That was a weird one.
